Posts.Content: Apr 5, 2008 06:20PM RuthS wrote: Hi Everyone! First off I think you guys an awesome and inspiration group for keeping up with your fitness routines. I have also gotten a great deal of important information from all of you, especially Trigeek. Thank you so much! I also wanted to let you know something important I learned this week. I had been running and working out for about an hour + each day and all was going very well. However, I did not realize how for up under my arm the radiation zone went and did not apply my ointments high enough or far enough toward my back. As as result the normal friction of a walking or running motion with my arms has caused the skin to "break down". It is not an actual blister, but it appears the top layer is history. I was spared treatment on Friday because the machine was broken and hope that a switch to silvadine and the 3 day brake will allow it to heal enough to resume tx on Monday. I don't think this would have happened had I applied the creams fully under my arm. I have completed 23 of 33 tx with the last 5 being boosts. Hope you are all having a great weekend! Ruth Dx 7/16/2007, IDC, 3.5cm, Stage IIb, Grade3, 3/25 nodes, ER-/PR-, HER-
